page.title: 08EROSION IN THE AREA
page.content: There are two main areas which are subject to erosion in the area. The first area is on the hillier parts. On the west-side of Brough-law hill there are extensive screes beginning at only 500 feet. On many of the other hills, vegetation is being eroded at an alarming rate. Some of the more popular paths on Brough-law are also showing signs of wear. The other major area of erosion is the river itself. Floods in winter can be severe. Thunderstorms over the hills very occasionally lead to walls of flood-water up to 6 feet high racing down the river. These floods lead to erosion of bank-side and in some parts of this area, lead to the narrow river having a very broad dry bed which leaves a broad scar along some of the valley
